main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) in Albuquerque, New Mexico on August 25, 1951, by credible witnesses including a civilian base security guard and his wife, as well as a sergeant and a farmer.
interesting points: The sightings described variously shaped, high-speed objects similar to saucers, disks, or flying wings, with estimated altitudes from 300 to 30,000 feet and speeds from 200 to 1,500 mph.
Witnesses reported no sound from the objects, unusual light patterns, and the sudden disappearance of the objects from sight.

The investigation involved the examination of photographs, radar records, weather conditions, background checks on witnesses, and coordination with various military and civilian aviation entities for corroboration.
The objects observed did not match known or identified aircraft, and attempts were made to verify the authenticity of photographs.
The sightings were considered significant, and the investigation remained open pending further evaluation, including comparison to similar sightings in Lubbock, Texas.
sighted object: variously shaped, high-speed objects similar to saucers, disks, or flying wings
witnesses: credible witnesses including a civilian base security guard and his wife, as well as a sergeant and a farmer
photographs: The investigation involved the examination of photographs
